TEXT.P: London's 1952 "Killer Smog" was largely the result of particulate emissions (soot) from residential and industrial coal-burning sources.

Particulates consist of any solid or liquid particles that are small enough to be carried aloft. Particulates originate from natural sources, such as dust, as well as from human sources. Particulates can cause damage to respiratory tissues when inhaled.
